Overall%20Experience.Review:
Great community spirit. 
Breadth of courses 
All inclusive and welcoming community
Great gym facilities
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: What I love most about Yale is the access to world-class resources and the inspiring community of peers and professors. The faculty are genuinely invested in students’ success, and the residential college system creates a close-knit, supportive environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The overall experience is good. The vibe is very friendly. Everyone is busy but nobody shows off how much they are doing. People genuinely see each other as individual humans and treat each other with kindness.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Positive and a good start to college life.  I found the campus to be safe and inviting. I liked how I was able to walk in one direction and find quiet and quaint spaces.  If I walked in the other direction I was able to be in the heart of the city.  It allowed someone like me to get a mix of high energy or quiet campus life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: being part of the Yale Young Global Scholar from this summer I really appreciate the diversity Yale brings to this campus and the university as a whole. The professors and students that helped with this program have been very welcoming and have showed me a different way of thinking. Showing us the life of a student and lecturing us about interesting topics you would not get taught in high school, Yale has been a great influence in my life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Overall Experience at Yale University

Yale University offers a rich and diverse experience characterized by academic excellence, a supportive residential college system, and a vibrant social life. Students benefit from small class sizes and access to renowned faculty, fostering deep intellectual engagement. The residential college system creates tight-knit communities that enhance social connections and provide mentorship opportunities. While the campus culture is lively, with numerous extracurricular activities, some students express concerns about the drinking culture and the pressure to excel academically, which can lead to stress. Additionally, navigating personal relationships can be challenging for some. Despite these issues, many students appreciate the diversity of thought and background at Yale, contributing to dynamic discussions both in and out of the classroom. Overall, Yale is seen as a transformative experience that shapes students’ identities long after graduation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I know that Yale is a very prestigious University,while growing up I've always dreamed of going there,so I recommend it for any student seeking for a better place to acquire knowledge
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review:
My Experience with Yale University

Although I haven't studied at Yale yet, my application process has been a deeply positive experience. Yale's commitment to sustainability and environmental studies, through its School of the Environment, truly aligns with my passion for addressing global sustainability challenges. The faculty and program offerings are impressive, and I appreciate their focus on real-world impact, especially concerning climate change and resource management.

What I particularly like about Yale is its robust support for international students and its emphasis on cross-disciplinary learning. The integration of cutting-edge research with practical solutions to global issues is an aspect that greatly appeals to me.

One area that could improve is accessibility for applicants from the Global South. While Yale offers numerous opportunities, expanding resources and outreach to potential students from underrepresented regions would further increase diversity
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am having lots of fun at Yale and it is really easy to meet new people at many events! Also, the food here is really good but the dining hall does close early.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, I really enjoyed my first year at Yale. There were lots of academic and professional opportunities, as well as extracurriculars and social events.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Aside from the obvious (great academics and professors), there are just so many great resources and opportunities available at Yale. Unfortunately, you don't get any guidance or help accessing them, which makes the already wide gap for first-gen and low-income students even wider despite generous need-based financial aid packages. Also, the university administration is extremely out of touch with the students, and the YPD abuses their power on unparalleled levels both on campus and in the city. The students at Yale are not very socioeconomically diverse (as one would expect) but for the most part very kind despite the prevailing culture of "maximizing how much work you have to do." The food is better than any other college food I've tasted. Unfortunately, most dorms don't have A/C. The surrounding city of New Haven is wonderful, especially once you've exited the radius where shops upcharge you. Student activism continues to make Yale a better place, e.g., improving mental healthcare.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I would like to see a bigger support network for low income students outside of orientation programs.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale University is an amazing experience for those who want an Ivy league education with a matching student life. The diversity provides a campus full of different backgrounds, races, and identities as a whole. Beyond that, Yale gives New Haven a prominent and proud name. Its influence is felt throughout the local area,  and a great example of that is me receiving a full ride Summer Session B scholarship. Being a local to New Haven, I appreciate what Yale brings to the city and those who inhabit it. The education I have received while being here has definitely given me a higher sense of aspiration and thirst for learning. Overall, Yale has been a wonderful experience and exactly what I would look for in my higher education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Enjoy all aspects of Yale. I enjoy the classes in the professors who seem to really care about my future. I enjoy the atmosphere the student population my dorm. I love my sweet mates. I would do anything to stay, but I am lacking funds so I really need some scholarships, thank you
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a wonderful time! It was the people both professors, faculty, staff, and students that made it great!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Love my time here! Amazing people and surrounding environment! Cannot wait to go back after the summer!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think Yale is one of the top institutions for an undergraduate education and it provides for an incredibly well-rounded campus life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had an amazing experience there. I enjoy their programs and look forward to more of it in the future.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is an incredible school. The professors and students are here only to learn and explore. None of the toxicity is found in other top universities. Easy to get classes, research, and feel truly welcomed and wanted. Wonderful school overall.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: There aren't many ways in which Yale can improve. The best teaching, impeccable student life, extensive extracurriculars, competitive internships, life-long friendships,  it's all given to you on a silver platter at Yale.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Incredible school. Probably the best university in the country and the greatest time of my life thus far. Everything I could have dreamed of and more.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Thus far, Yale has been a transformative experience for me. Their generous financial aid, along with incredible support has made the transition from high school to college incredibly easy. The amount of opportunities available here is incredible.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is amazing overall! Campus is full of activities and there's always something to do. New Haven may not be the greatest city in America, but that just makes students be more active on campus and creates a sense of community! Yale also has the perfect balance of academics, extracurriculars, and social life, or as we like to think about it, the 8/8/8 rule: 8 hours of studying, 8 of sleep, and 8 of social life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: All schools will have their pros and cons, but attending Yale was a fantastic experience. Being surrounded by equally driven and motivated peers was the most rewarding part of my experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's challenging to experience a faster-paced environment when in graduate school. It can be a little hectic at times but I remind myself that I'm grateful to be here and it'll be worth it in the end.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Academics are top-tier. Professors care deeply about students as they both challenge and nurture them throughout their educational journeys
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved my time at Yale - my classmates were fantastic, and the school put in a lot of effort (and funding) to foster community through events, student organizations, school traditions, etc.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale University is known for its academics, but what really is special about attending the college is the other students you will meet during your time here. Like you, they are passionate about learning, and everyone has their own special niche. I love hearing about my friend's interests.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: As someone who came from a low-income community and attended an underfunded high school, Yale is a dream come true. There are a plethora of resources for students with backgrounds like me, along with resources for the general student population. I like that Yale provides peer tutors for most STEM classes and writing tutors within the residential colleges (Hogwarts Houses) and the library's writing center. Additionally, the professors I've had thus far are wonderful and extremely helpful. They seem like they genuinely want their students to thrive and are willing to take some of their own time to help them. The student community at Yale is amazing and diverse. There is an astounding amount of clubs and activities for students to join, and I'm grateful for the many options I have. The housing at Yale can be hit-or-miss, especially when comparing the new residential colleges with the older ones. However, Yale's residential college system fosters a welcoming and tight-knit community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale has definitely opened up a lot of opportunities for me, and has allowed me to study with knowledgeable professors and meet a bunch of amazing people from all over the world. There is definitely a hustle culture here, and sometimes that can feel overwhelming. It is hard not to compare myself to others, especially once I became an upperclassman and the people around me started getting jobs. There are some absurd aspects of going here, like the student body being so rich and from backgrounds with access to a lot of resources. I think some of these weird parts of going to Yale feel so normal because we don't know any different. Financial aid has been generous but there are a lot of aspects of going to school out of state and in a city that are hard financially. There also isn't enough housing for all of the students which I think is a problem considering Yale keeps admitting more people. The students here are generally really nice and there are many avenues for a robust social life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: While cliche, I can certainly affirm that the best part about Yale is the people. Whether it's campus life, intramurals, or even just casual hangouts, the diverse array of Yalies and their interesting skills/experiences is what makes Yale great. On the flip side, I'd critique Yale's STEM department, where lots of the teaching has been to my disappointment (whether it's having a grad student teach core classes, being given insufficient test prep materials, horrible lecturing, etc.).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved my time at Yale. New Haven is the best city to go to school in: fun and safe bars, delicious food, and buzzing culture. Students at Yale are shockingly down-to-earth, artsy, and driven.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Cool University i met a lot of people the network is amazing , i learned so much in this uni , so is an overall great uni
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Love the community and friends and alumni of Yale. This is where I met the most interesting people of my life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The amenities are great! Food, access to inspiring spaces, etc. However, it’s really clear that the school does not care about their students unless you can serve them in some sort of way. Incredibly unequal treatment and does not in any way attempt to be a support system. 

Faculty can sometimes follow this logic, believing that rules are very set in stone and if you cannot meet the requirements, then your failure is only yourself to blame. 

This is not to say that there are no safe and supportive spaces— there are many to choose from— but Yale itself is ruthless and does not care for your well-being, only your statistics.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I mean I loved college. It wad super cool and I made a lot of friends. It wad one of the most challenging yet fruitful experiences of my life. Faculty is great, facilities are great. The overall environment  screams passion and adventure
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: While the reputation of Yale does hold up, there are sacrifices that must take place for the students to also hold up their reputation at Yale. Overall, a best school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: What I love most about Yale is the world-class academics and incredible community of professors and students. It's hard to describe just how great it is to be among intellectually curious people who genuinely love learning. The college fosters a collaborative culture where the people you meet and the quality of the community you live in matters more than prestige of the university brand. The resources for student projects and activities are incredible, so there are endless opportunities for extracurriculars and outstanding social life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing experience and I found a great job right after school. I recommend 100%. Loved the teachers, communities and sports.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is well-known for its challenging academic programs and top-tier faculty. The prospect of delving into diverse academic disciplines and majors excites me. The intimate class sizes would cultivate meaningful interactions with professors, providing the ideal environment for in-depth discussions and research opportunities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: While not perfect, it's an incredible place. Unrivalled peers, fun setting that isn't as isolating as larger cities. Great research opportunities that will set you up for any possible grad programs. Extremely fun social scene that is great for people who didn't go crazy prior to college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is a beautiful university with some great professors and amazing classmates! I enjoyed my time as an undegradute and blessed to  be able to continue my studies as a graduate student.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is renowned for its rigorous academic programs and world-class faculty. I would have the opportunity to explore a wide range of academic disciplines and majors. The small class sizes would foster close interactions with professors, allowing for in-depth discussions and research opportunities. Yale's commitment to academic excellence would challenge me to think critically and pursue my intellectual passions. Challenges: While the Yale experience is rich and rewarding, it can also be academically demanding and competitive. Balancing coursework, extracurricular commitments, and personal life may present challenges, and students may experience stress at times. In summary, being a student at Yale University would offer a dynamic and intellectually stimulating experience, with a strong focus on academic excellence, community engagement, and personal growth. However, it would also come with its share of academic challenges and demands which are typical of a top-tier institution like Yale
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale has been an amazing experience. The community here is like no other, in part because of the residential colleges, but also because of the university’s emphasis on undergraduate teaching and student resources. World-class professors not only teach all levels of classes, but are very accessible to undergraduates. Every residential college has a head who is an accomplished scholar who lives in the college, and each college has its own dining hall, library, gym, theater/entertainment, and buttery. So it feels like home within the larger university. Most of all, I love student culture which is engaged, passionate, and knows how to have fun.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'm a proud parent of a son who is a Yale Class of 2027 member. My son had a tough decision in choosing his college as he was accepted to several elite universities. Yale rolled out the red carpet during the admitted student days known as Bulldog Days. They had a full schedule of fun and engaging activities to demonstrate to students what life is like. As a parent, we were impressed with the multiple support layers and the welcoming environment. On move-in day, we had an enjoyable experience. Current students came out to cheer and welcome my son. The residential college system is exceptional for the family atmosphere and support. My son picked the right school for him. Yale is a magnificent and magical place.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I don't have any specific thing about Yale but it's a good and excellent university for international students and it's inspired me to do a lot of stuffs.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the plethora of opportunity that is provided at Yale. Yale gives the opportunity for students to make their academic experience their own through a variety of interesting classes and the initiative for students to embrace and/or in their lives. It is easy to find a club or extra curricular that fits within your interests. I love the amount of singing groups, dance groups, and theatrical groups on campus. I would like to see less of a competitive nature between the students. Sometimes, seeing the people around you continue to strive for higher 24/7 can feel overwhelming and give the unnecessary feeling of needing to catch up.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I attend the 2023 Yale Young Global Scholars program, which gave me insight into how global issues are interconnected to one another using systems thinking.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Everyone is extreemly nice and the professors are super caring about their students. The classes were engaging and very intresting.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: It’s rigorous academically, but in a fulfilling and rewarding way. I enjoy the variety of classes offered, and have found rather unique learning opportunities. I have also made great connections with my peers across campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had wonderful academic and professional opportunities, amazing professors, and phenomenal friends because I attended Yale.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is gorgeous and the professors and people are all very friendly. The food is also very delicious and there are lots of options for study spots.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: There's a reason it's one of the best schools in the nation! To be honest though, some of their policies were completely outdated and created personal trauma for individuals. This was in 2004/2005, so hopefully they've adjusted with the times.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Phenomenal school with phenomenal students and faculty. Plethora of resources coupled with an encouragement to pursue diverse fields of interest.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale has amazing faculty, student body, and resources like the library, study spaces, and great dining halls, as well as an awesome residential college system.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I would make this choice again in a heartbeat. Yale is a place where you will find some of the best friendships you will ever have. It is a place where you will have the opportunity to explore any interest or develop any ability you may desire. It is a place of opportunity like no other and one to take advantage of. But even though there are other schools that could offer similar resources, what makes Yale unique is the holistic experience you will have as a student here. To give an example: I have not spoken to any other Ivy League student who is as overall happy and content in their institution as the students at Yale are. Every single person you meet on campus will tell you the same thing: if you are admitted, Yale should not be just another option. It should be the only choice you consider.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale University is like no other!!! I really enjoy the diversity of the students. The professors are extremely tremendous and offer humongous support.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: They have a really cool college that is nice to walk around and to talk with the students. Overall great!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the people--professionally it is the perfect place for networking and meeting the smartest people in the fields you're interested in. Furthermore, there are some wonderful people here, the social life is somewhat mid though, LOL.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As an engineering major, Yale may not have the best ranking compared to other Ivies and T20s, but the amount of research and extracurricular opportunities at Yale levels that off.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I was lucky to get accepted at Yale and I'm proud to be a Bulldog. The academics are stellar as well as the opportunities to participate in a diverse set of activities. One very unique thing about Yale is the housing system. As a freshman, you are randomly assigned to a 'college' that is your dormitory for four years. You are associated with that 'college' for your four years. Each 'college' has distinct customs and traditions. The academic atmosphere and social interactions are very unique at Yale.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Thanks to the great professors who were interested in my success as a student and after graduation, I enjoyed learning at Yale. It wasn't easy but it was also doable, and less stressful than in high school. There are so many interesting courses to choose from and amazing students that you can make the experience as unique and impactful as you want it to be with experts who can guide you. Having had the liberal arts background for my career really allowed me to adapt easily to various career opportunities. I'd go back and do it again in a second. I loved my four years at Yale and have made life long friends that I truly treasure, not to mention married my partner who also graduated from Yale. My ratings are based on what I know about Yale today, not when I attended so long ago. However, I visit Yale often and think all the changes have been for the better.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the campus, although it was after a Yale Prospect football camp so some buildings were closed. I’m just excited to go on a Official Visit
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing experience overall. Great professors. Good balance of academic and social life. Puts the well being of students, both physical and emotional/mental health, first.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love that Yale has multiple opportunities for you to engage with other students and the faculty. The campus is very resourceful and accessible.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Loved my freshmen year. Campus is so beautiful. Dorms and dining halls are both pretty good, although there is a pretty big range on the quality of both depending on where you live.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Yale has allowed me to explore diverse areas of knowledge, leading to the development of interests I was not initially aware I had. Entering Yale as a STEM major, I never thought I would become such a fan of abstract philosophical debate, but now, I would just as happily engage in a conversation about the metaphysics of the world as a conversation about the cancer microenvironment. 

I admire how Yale fosters an environment that enables the realization of any idea or dream. As an engineer, I have especially appreciated the resources offered by the Center of Engineering, Innovation, and Design (CEID) and Tsai City to transform abstract ideas into physical products en route to commercialization. Yale provides a wealth of resources (mentorship and guidance, funds, and instruction) that allow students to pursue any projects they desire.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Yale has been a fun and enjoyable experience overall. I would definitely choose Yale again if I had to re-do my college application. 
Academics: some departments are better taught than other departments. Yale can be weaker in CS and Math compared to other universities, but most alums are still very successful. Like most colleges, there is a lot of independent learning and there are numerous resources to help you. The environment is not competitive unless premed.
Social life: Yale has an AMAZING social life compared to other universities of equal caliber. There is always something going on and you can be as social as you want. Social life is nonexistent during midterm season. There are parties, frats, concerts, woads, club formals, and many other events.
Sports: Not a big sports school but many students are involved in club sports.
Yale dining is delicious and healthy!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Great academics. Occasionally toxic culture. 

I didn’t know what I was getting myself into. I’m glad I went but I am still recovering.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's great and a really cool school that you should definitely apply to because everything about it is amazing
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The atmosphere is overall good, I just wish the food was better and the professors weren't so 'woke'. The town of New Haven needs to be cleaned up a bit, there are a lot of panhandlers asking students for money. It could be a nicer / safer area.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: "Yale is at once a tradition, a company of scholars, a society of friends." This school changed the trajectory of my life, and despite complaints about various small things, I'd definitely choose Yale again if I had the chance. The community really is diverse, but it's not special because it's diverse -- it's special because people reach across their differences and spend time with people who might be their polar opposites.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Boola Boola! The best people you will ever meet coupled with the most vigorous learning experience you can imagine!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale University is an excellent school both academically and socially. I felt welcomed and supported as a minority student. I found interesting social groups easily and quickly. I am planning to major in the humanities department which is partly why I picked Yale. The university excels in this department, and I found that other schools I researched did not invest as much in the humanities and were more STEM focused. I grew up in New Haven and I love the city. I appreciate Yale's social justice commitment to the local New Haven community. Overall, I am happy with my school of choice.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the college campus, the competitive yet welcoming atmosphere, and the general stuff too!! Absolutely recommend.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Undergraduate study at Yale is incredibly rewarding. The residential college system gives a much healthier environment than one would expect from a competitive school. Each college has its own resources for students, on top of the many other resources available ranging from career guidance to mental health and counselling.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Changed my life forever. Truly the greatest combination of academics, creative extracurriculars, and passionate students you could ever hope for.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale has an amazing campus filled with amazing people. Tons of opportunities from the get go, so many majors to choose from and the student life is great!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Well, what I loved about my experience at Yale is the people. I cannot describe how much 'at home' I felt at Yale as an international student. Plus, the professors are amazing and always there to help us out. The food is great and the town feeling is amazing. The residential system is a very enriching experience and the school spirit is very high, hence the whole community feels like a close-knit family. The course requirements are pretty flexible which was a great attraction for me as a liberal arts enthusiast. The music groups are amazing, which is another one of my favorite things about Yale. The party scene is really better than what people might actually imagine. The people are really hardworking but also know how to have fun. Hence, there's a pretty good balance of academic and social life if one can manage their time wisely. The school administration is very dedicated to improving the school and is always open for discussions and suggestions. Definitely, it's a great experience
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've had an amazing undergraduate experience at Yale, even considering that fact that three of my semesters were online because of the pandemic. I've loved the majority of my classes and the resources available to students (tutoring, financial aid, etc) are amazing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great professors! Very nice and intellectual students with differing ideas and personalities. Very diverse university racially and academically
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'm convinced Yale is the most eclectic, intelligent and affable community on the planet. Everyone is incredibly approachable. It's almost as if kindness and empathy is hard-wired into the students it admits. This is a college that will do everything it can to for you to be able to follow your passions and pursue your wildest dreams, and you will feel incredibly supported and uplifted by the faculty in doing so. I've had so much fun here! You will find your people at Yale. Truly world-class.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great campus. As cliche as it sounds, the people here are amazing! Academics is  top-notch, and campus food is great also.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As an international student, Yale has been such a supportive community—from as the administration through to my colleagues. The university provides such a vast number of opportunities for growth both as a person and from a strictly educational perspective. The conversations I am able to have with people here are unmatched by any of my previous experiences.

The opportunity for scientific research as a first-year student, even during a pandemic, is one of the things which has resonated with me. And in relation to the pandemic, Yale has taken reasonable measures to ensure the safety of the community on a whole and to keep the university functioning as normally as possible. In general, it is a phenomenal school with phenomenal members the body of which is greater than the sum of its parts.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is an amazing school! The professors and students are all encouraging and friendly. Everyone there deserves to be there, which makes the learning environment extremely rewarding and stimulating. There are so many resources to help you navigate your time at Yale, especially during your first-year. You immediately build a community within your residential college, and can find a group instantly through classes or extracurriculars. The campus is beautiful, intertwined with the city. The courtyards of the residential colleges and the buildings on campus are unmatched by any other university in the country. Everyone is extremely friendly, all while you are earning a world-class education and building connections that will last for years to come.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale overall is the best place to spend your undergraduate years. The academics are amazing and allow you to expand your mind in ways never before, if you let yourself. The city of New Haven is honestly a great place to spend college because of its urban environment while giving a small town feel. Yale really tries to make sure it feels like home to its students and I feel that it succeeds.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale University certainly lives up to its prestigious reputation.  There are so many undergraduate opportunities and experiences, as well as a diverse student body and faculty, and that gives Yale a unique character.  It is amazing to meet many of the world's leading professionals and academics, and it is an honor to learn from them--and even work with them.   Most of all, Yale is a collaborative environment where the students support each other, rather than compete with each other.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: There are outstanding professors and library resources at Yale; however, admission into classes and even extracurricular groups gets fiercely competitive. Also, although Yale is trying to brand itself as more of a STEM school these days, it is still sorely lacking in many STEM areas, with insufficient faculty and limited class offerings.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The student body at Yale is multifaceted, diverse, and extremely talented. Living, learning, and working among students from all over the world is eye-opening and broadening, even beyond the incredible education provided by the knowledgeable and accomplished faculty.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Lives up to its name. The professors actively try to help you and serve as resources. The student life is enriching.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the campus. You can feel the history through the architechture. However, New Haven is not the most inviting town so stay on campus. There is so much happening on campus as well, its a terrific environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a first generation, low income student it was a bit of a culture shock  when I first arrived to Yale. The rich people are very cliquey, but that's life. I have met some really cool people though and surrounding myself with people that care about me and know how to have a balanced social/school life has been great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: haven't even started there yet but i'm so excited to. admissions process is great and they do a lot to get you connected to other incoming freshmen
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I went on a college tour at Yale University and absolutely loved it. The buildings were nice and the people there were so friendl It makes e feel a part of thir faily before attedning there already!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: i think there is a lot of room here to be yourself. it's not a sporty school, but there is a big WASP atmosphere present. New haven has its ups and downs
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Going there helped me fit it, not at all what I expected. The environment isn't rigid, cold, and cutthroat but rather welcoming and passionate. Everyone is driven to work together toward what is best.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is really great! The community is super supportive while also being competitive. There is plenty to do and see at Yale. If you are interested in joining clubs they have hundreds of clubs in all sorts of areas of interest.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: People who gave New Haven a C+ are literally racist and just scared of black people because of their whitewashed upbringing. How does Columbia have a higher safety rating when one of their students was stabbed to death last month? New Haven is safe, some people are just bigoted.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: From the moment I stepped on campus, the students and professors were extremely welcoming and committed to making every student feel at home. The residential colleges allow first years to have a small, tight-knit community that is enriched through social and cultural events. The academics are top notch in every department with accessible and enthusiastic professors that push their students to achieve greatness. The party scene is incredible and open for students to enjoy on the weekends as a way to connect with others. Although people who have never visited New Haven are concerned about safety, Yale does an amazing job of making sure the campus is safe at all hours and works to connect Yale students to the city of New Haven.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the sense of community here, being a part of a residential college really gives you somewhere to belong. There are also so many extracurriculars available that its easy to be overwhelmed by the choice! Although Yale has been a mostly positive experience, I would love to see the Student Income Contribution get eliminated, so FGLI students aren't obligated to work in order to have a place at Yale.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: There is no place like Yale. The community is supportive and the campus is absolutely gorgeous. New Haven is a perfectly place for anyone that wants a college town experience with a mixture of the big city feel. The campus is huge and there are great eateries all around the campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: My expectations were high coming in, but they were far exceeded in every way. Life at Yale is incredible in all aspects.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great college! They say the more options you have the more regrets you'll have, and that has been true of my Yale experience. While I do not regret doing the things I did do, I do wish I had more than 24 hours in a day so I could do even more! There is so much to do in terms of career development, extra-curriculars, and just entertainment in general. There are so many classes to choose from and most of the professors are incredible not just as professors, but as people in general. If I could redo college I would definitely choose Yale again!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale University is an amazing school. It is home to a variety of students with diverse backgrounds and interests, and provides its students with all the resources necessary to succeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing school with some of the best people I have ever met. Professors (for the most part) genuinely care about you and how well you know the material. Very easy to set up meetings/lunches with them. Many different on campus events and summer opportunities that can be found. It can be a bit difficult to navigate Yale's website since there are so many and it's not that organized but as long as you google, you can find internships, research labs, etc. Decent food and amazing dining hall staff members. The new residential colleges have amazing dorms (really big) and facilities (being a Paulimur). Pretty good support in terms of career help. There are daily drop-in hour times that offer resume/cover letter help. Lots of different clubs available although most of them have an application process which in my opinion can be slightly annoying.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I love Yale University because it is wonderful, unique, supportive place filled with brilliant, interesting and fun people. In my opinion, other schools can't offer the sense of community that the residential college system fosters, or simply support their students with as much funding, resources and advice. 
"Urim and Thummim"
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is an amazing university that has some of the best academics, values, and curriculum, but lacks in providing a good typical college experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Love the school and wouldnt change anything about it! The university truly cares about each student’s success and support in doing so.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: World-renown institution with impeccable resources and educational opportunities. Unfortunately the University still has some growing pains with diversity, resources, and affordability.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: unique experience, students are happy, food is great, professors are the best in the world!!! Yale is a place for young minds to develop and change the world
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Love it! I am constantly academically challenged and have really felt like I'm truly learning at Yale. The people are amazing, and it is an incredible experience to be surrounded by so many talented students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: An amazing school with so many different positive qualities about it! There's also a lot of balance - Greek life doesn't dominate but it's still there and pretty open to most people. Academics are challenging/rigorous but so captivating that you're motivated to work hard. There is a variety of social, political, economic, religious views represented on campus and yet almost everyone is respectful and open about getting to know about why you think the way you do. To cut a long story short - best college in the world, and I couldn't be happier.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale offers incredible opportunities for its students whether its in-depth research, travel abroad programs, or amazing extra curricular activities. There is so much to do on campus, it can feel overwhelming at times. There is plenty of support and people to turn to for help.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is the best. The students are well-rounded, kind, and eager to learn. The professors care about teaching and want the students to do well. The environment is very collaborative, which is a product of the small class sizes and residential college system.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus tours are fantastic! The students gave incredible insight in being a student at Yale University.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: While on spring break, I went on a college visit to this school. They presented well and I enjoyed the experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I really like the online courses from Yale University, you can choose btw a lot of different subjects and get smarter.
And the proffessors are amazing!
This university changed me a lot. Not only do I feel like an expert in my area of study, but I have been taught to write and speak in a much more compelling way than ever before. The university is very conducive to fostering strong friendships among undergrads. I have close networks of friends that I could not have formed elsewhere
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I really like the online courses from Yale University, you can choose btw a lot of different subjects and get smarter.
And the proffessors are amazing!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: This university changed me a lot. Not only do I feel like an expert in my area of study, but I have been taught to write and speak in a much more compelling way than ever before. The university is very conducive to fostering strong friendships among undergrads. I have close networks of friends that I could not have formed elsewhere.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great school and great experience so far! I love everything about it and can’t wait to spend the next 3 years here!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great people, education, campus life, environment, restaurants, you name it! This college is definitely meant for everyone!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is absolutely gorgeous, rich with history and amazing architecture. The fact that Yale is a smaller college not only allows you to walk wherever you need to go, but the individualized attention you receive from professors and administration sets this school apart from everything else. You get to know everyone on a personal level and the staff truly wants you to do well. This school is a must.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love being in this school because there is no limitations on your abilities. The professors I've had, push and believe in me. My school is encourages creativity in thought, instead of being average.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale University is basically the most beautiful school in the world, by far. I still can't believe just how gorgeous the place is. Sometimes when I'm walking around by myself on the old campus, I just want to pinch myself. It's pretty much the "Blue Steel" of colleges and universities. Funny story, but my African mom basically describes it in the following terms: "ohh, it all looks like Harry Potter's world! I bet this is where he really goes to school!".
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Best school in the country. Incredible financial aid, sports, campus, academics (obviously). Food is great too.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale University is an amazing school with amazing resources. It is special because of the name: it draws faculty and speakers with interesting backgrounds and experience you can learn from. the huge endowment provides great opportunities for financial aid (and therefore diversity). It is so beautiful in and out of the buildings. If you can get used to the weather, it is a great place to be a student.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale was amazing! I felt like I belonged there and now I am a software engineer who makes $240,000 a year. Couldn't have done it without Yale.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Surrounded by talented peers, excellent professors. Definitely still a university that bears marks of its past as a finishing school for the wealthy.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing people who are so diverse and incredibly humble. Great Professors, some of the best in the world. Residential colleges make for supportive communities and it’s much easier to make friends and get to know your classmates.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: When I went there for my YYGS program, it was nothing but amazing. The staff was friendly there (especially the lunchladies) as well as the professors there. The campus is also beautiful!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I knew a lot of people who talked about Yale's community before coming here, but I honestly didn't really take it too seriously. However, after just a semester here, I see exactly what people mean and truly think it differentiates it from other top schools. Students aren't backstab-by or overly competitive; high school was honestly more competitive from my experience. Other students are always willing to share notes, form study groups, and generally be helpful. It creates a very positive environment which honestly is so healthy and makes college so much more fun.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is good, but can be better! Academic environment is excellent. The city is very exotic. Amazing library! Shuttles are perfect. You can whereever you want in the city whenever you want! This makes you feel safe.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Academically, Yale was amazing but very rigorous. I wish that I could’ve spent more time enjoying Yale and less time just trying to survive it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have heard many great things about Yale but what I experienced during my two week program at Yale is why I am writing this now. I really enjoyed the engaging lectures by Yale professors and I corresponded with a few of them to learn more about their research. I visited laboratories and met up with a professor who works at Fermilab, astounded by the facilities and opportunities available at Yale. It would be really exciting to be able to participate in such research and I like the emphasis on involving undergraduates.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: My favorite part of the place is definitely the people. Everyone is world-class and super humber and down to Earth. I definitely recommend this place to everyone
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great academic experiences to be had at Yale. The college is full of amazing and interesting people, but the city and area Yale is in is not the greatest. It is in a good location, though, as it is close to nyc, boston, etc.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is a great place to be a student - variety of class offerings even as a grad student, and plenty of cool events and opportunities among the different schools and departments, though food and housing options around campus are not always as great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: When stepping on Yale's campus for the very first time, I immediately felt welcomed and comfortable with the environment I had just entered. Each individual that I encountered was different than the rest, proving  to me that Yale values establishing a diverse community that embodies similar values to  me. Yale is a place where creativity and dreams  come to life which is why I chose  to attend the university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: All of the students at Yale are kind and are passionate about something. There is a community for every kind of person. Diversity can be improved. Many students of color have reported racial incidents on campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I was able to really find my niche and find my people there. I specialized in what I wanted to study, and was able to explore education in ways I had never previously known were possible.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale University has an amazing atmosphere, a dream school for anyone wishing to major in anything. The campus is not too large and it feels comforting.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: This is a great private school for students prospecting to go on to law school or business school. Also, if a student is medical-oriented, then there is a wide variety of laboratories for research.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I don't need to tell you that Yale is a world-class university with renowned faculty and seemingly unlimited resources. But you might not realize that it is also an extremely open and welcoming community where you will find every single type of person you can think of, and where it is possible to have literally any kind of social experience you like, whether that means Greek life, D-I varsity athletics, international trips with your music group, working on top-notch publications and productions, clubbing every night, or never leaving the library. Whatever you are looking for exists here. If you would like to not only be in awe of your peers, but feel at home among them, Yale is your place. It really is so much more than a school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's an amazing university, full of talented students and brilliant staff. Yale does a fantastic job of giving you a well-rounded, liberal arts education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I"m not yet enrolled at Yale, but my experience with the college so far has proved positive in every regard. The school sets a high priority on helping every student to excel, with an atmosphere that is challenging and relevant to our society.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great! A beautiful campus with so many resources to have an amazing college experience. Highly recommend
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is, like most things, what you make of it. It has resources that couldn't be dreamed of in most schools (dorm rooms, residential colleges, fellowships, advisors, career offices). But sometimes the richness of the opportunities confuses and overwhelms people to the point of not really taking advantage of them as fully as they can.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great college.  Felt like i made a great choice to attend Yale.  Teachers are excellent and are interested in teaching.  Students are very friendly and the atmosphere is very conducive to learning.  Enjoying the sporting community, the arts atmosphere and the student life.  Very easy to get around campus and feel very safe.  Weather has been great thus far.  I feel challenged in my classes and i have to work hard to stay ahead.  Great class opportunities.  Flexibility in choosing major and easy to talk to professors about college goals.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The students are extremely kind, the professors are very involved and available, and the campus is beautiful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale offers a great breadth of academic courses, thus allowing students to explore different majors that they may be contemplating. The group approach to studying  courses involving math and science can be beneficial or detrimental, depending on how one best learns. The campus is spread throughout an urban city,  so one has to use awareness as navigating an "open" campus. Student life is improved by creating bonds with the advisers, deans, and peers that Yale matches one with to avoid isolation. Interest groups also keep one inspired while attaining academic goals. Lastly, dorm life, in general, is good including  gym, laundry facilities and junk food splurge nights.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: There is definitely a large adjustment to be made in your first year when students are first exposed to many realities quite different than in high school. Going from the top of the class to just trying to beat the average can be intimidating, but the amount of resources here is truly amazing. Many people are looking out for you and want to help, so although the academic adjustment was quite difficult, the competition is manageable because for the most part, people are very helpful and supportive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Check out the open yale courses online! Amazing resources! I cannot recommend this enough. As a member of the class of 2022, I am obsessed with everything about this college and I can’t wait to step foot on campus!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Everyone at Yale is very self-motivated, and that can be both very refreshing in the classroom and overwhelming. Regardless, Yale provides plenty of support to transitioning first-years with their residential college system and access to the multicultural centers on campus. It is extremely difficult to fail at Yale because of all of the people: Professors, Frocos, College Heads, etc. that are around to cheer you on along the way.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I lived at Morse College, great food, great dorm, and great people. I think it is one of the best locations on campus, right in front of the Payne Whitney Gym. 
Professors are great; my personal favorite is Physics Professor Daniel Prober. Best moment in his APHY 120 course is he took off his shoes while listening to a student presentation LOL.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale has been an amazing place so far. It brings together people with interesting stories who are super kind and overall really great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is a highly diverse university with exceptionally friendly and helpful faculty, staff, and students. The food is beyond exceptional, taking sustainability, food waste, health, and nutrition in mind when it comes to every dish. I'm always learning new things each time I step foot on campus. I can't say enough about this place!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Works Here

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is one of the best experiences, and the 'Ivy League' title is a silver lining. YAle yale yale yale yale yale yale yale!!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is the most amazing place. Though when I think of Yale I first think of old white men reading old white books, it really isn't that anymore. It is an involved, active campus with an incredible amount of diversity. Most people here are excited to be here, and the residential college system really is the best.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Although my first two years were a bit rough, I absolutely adore Yale. The financial aid is generous, the campus is beautiful, the curriculum is both challenging and interesting, and the variety of extracurricular activities and funding available to students is still overwhelming to me, even in my final year.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The sense of community is phenomenal. Yale truly fosters individual growth and strives to make college an experience worth having, not just a means to an end. I, along with mostly everyone, love it here. <3
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale managed to exceed my expectations. I originally chose Yale because of how genuine every student I met was and that perception continues to persist. I have met the most interesting and talented people while at Yale and have made some of the closest friends. One moment we'll be discussing a bio problem set, the next discussing the real solution to economic disparity, the next talking about our upbringings. While it's easy to think of Yale as a competitive college, I think that's far from the truth. I have never collaborated as much as I have at Yale. Everyone wants the best for each other and grades are not a focus. The social scene at Yale is also great. Frat parties are open to anyone for the most part and it's very easy to get integrated with Greek life members even if you aren't in it yourself. Just based off of the year I've been here, I can already say that Yale has changed me to be a more well-rounded person.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the diverse campus and culture around Yale. New Haven is comparable to New York, one of the most diverse cities in the world and where I currently reside in. It is amazing and has some of the best restaurants and culinary foods available.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: After being here for two years, I feel that I belong. It can take a while but there are amazing people here that devote themselves to the students they serve. At the same time, Yale is by no means perfect; it can improve in terms of diversity (racially and socioeconomically) and administration can be more responsive. Overall, however, I can't complain.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is everything you dream of and more. Walking through these century-old libraries with the gothic architecture...you really don't get more Ivy League than Yale. As a graduate student, I sometimes feel a little removed from the main campus, but overall the college community is incredibly open and accepting. The opportunities that this school affords you just by name recognition alone makes it worth attending.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think what makes Yale what it is is the people. Everyone here has something about which they're incredibly passionate, and you feel that in the buzz of energy around campus-- everyone is always busy doing something, meeting someone, or going somewhere. While it can sometimes be hard to find your niche (isn't it always, though?, especially with so many deeply invested Yalies, it's ultimately become a home and a place with so many incredible memories, so much academic and personal growth, and so much I'll miss when I leave. We're already planning our reunions.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is the best school out there. It is ranked number one on the charts of schools, and it's an ivy league school so with a degree from this school, you'll have a great feature ahead of you.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Good sense of community. New Haven isnt great because its small. The liberal arts courses are pretty interesting. However they are adding two new residential colleges (and not hiring more professors) which will make it more difficult to get into popular classes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Yale. Is. A. Top-notch. School.

Most of the students are very grateful to be there.  They are all so hardworking and inspiring people.

Yale has many enviable resources and study abroad programs.  I don't see why'd anyone wouldn't want to go.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: this is the place which makes you feel like you're on the right track to your success. Professors are very supportive. If you are intimidated of the school's big name, you shouldn't be. Because it's the place full of humans that are just a little bit hyped
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Even though I've only been here for two months, I already feel like Yale is my home. I love the people, the residential college system, the professors, and all my classes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Professors are the finest of their fields and love teaching. Yale is one of the premier research universities, but a special emphasis is placed upon the undergraduate college. We have hundreds of amazing extra curriculars and an unparalleled course catalogue. Yale is a very special place, not the least of which is because of its people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale students care not only about their studies, but about so much more. Whether they are singers, reporters, debaters, or athletes, the typical Yale student is engaged in both learning and extra curriculars.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The best times of my life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: IT was so much fun
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The people, both students and faculty, are extremely friendly and welcoming and try to make sure that everyone has the best experience possible. The students come from all types of backgrounds and are extremely intelligent and passionate in so many things. The academics at my school are unparalleled and the professors always try to ensure that all of their students excel and are willing to help in order to accomplish that.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The professors are always very accommodating and intelligent.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale has not only met all but has exceeded my expectations. I would recommend Yale to anyone and everyone!
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: There are so many course offerings, it's hard to choose.  Shopping period is wonderful, but it also can be an added source of stress if you're indecisive, like I am.  But if you choose well, you will find that your classes are engaging, your professors really care about teaching, and it's one of the best academic experiences available anywhere.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: You learn something new from every person you meet here!
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The class sizes are the perfect size. The professors really care about their student and what they teach.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is very educational and everyone who has gone their has had a great time.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have not yet started at Yale but my experience interviewing and doing the admissions day was fantastic, and I have total faith in the faculty. I can't wait to start.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Some of the professors could make their classes more interesting.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a great school, especially if you plan to major in humanities or simply want to have  a broad, wonderful education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Everything is really great. It's a very good school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is very wonderful! Classes are meaningful and teach you a lot. Also, extracurriculars are good and there are many opportunities. Additionally, the community is great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love this place. I would gladly choose it again.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love it. I would choose it again. It's been a home away from home. Of course, there have been some problems, but no school is perfect (and no home is perfect either).
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The people you meet everyday are intellectual and hold very interesting conversations. Very liberal school, very open. Professors are passionate and helpful. Many extracurriculars to get involved in. Wonderful experience overall.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Had a rough time with some intro STEM classes, but have had the best time in social science classes. Awesome profs, TAs, variety of courses, variety of seminars v lectures. Hard to get into seminars but great when you do.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Classes are great (except for the intro ones), professors are great, people are great
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Everything I expected it to be, but the reality of a dream is better than a vague dream
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: STEM dreams crushed. Came from a high school that wasn't the best so was unprepared for the workload. On the other hand, if you're artsy this is the place to be. Am currently reevaluating what I want in life. There are so many options.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Yep, it's hard. It should be. But for everything that is frustrating, there is a lot more that makes it all worth it.

Frustrating things: really rough intro STEM courses, getting into popular seminars, res colleges can make living with friends not in college difficult, shopping period is insanity, freshman advising isn't set up well, working with distributional requirements, sometimes Yale as an institution (i.e. Yale Corporation) is s***ty

Amazing things: people people all the people, friends, most professors, most TAs, post-freshman-year advisors, most things about the residential college system, dining hall staff, dining hall food, living spaces, extracurriculars holy PANTS BATMAN (service, politics, music, theatre, literally anything you can think of), engaging courses, insane course variety, requirements exist but there are no gen-eds, student activism, amazing student responses to s***ty situations, people compete with themselves not each other, generally very chill loving friendly non-competitive passionate student body
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: At first, I was very homesick as I am from California but after I got over that I realized that I am in one of the most amazing places in the world. I can't imagine myself anywhere and I know everyday I am surrounded by the movers and shakers of the future.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale is very accommodating. You can do a lot here!
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: This school is unique because the professors have a true passion to teach and help push you to succeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's hard to find your place but people here are generally pretty open and so a lot of opportunities to make friends and try new things are available.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the atmosphere at Yale. It has so many interesting and fun things going on, and is also strong in academics.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Residential colleges makes it home away from home.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Being from the west coast, it has been difficult to be on the east coast for full semesters without returning home, but I have pushed through by building great relationships with peers and professors. There are so many opportunities at Yale - it is unbelievable and sometimes paralyzing, but you gotta go for all that you can get your hands on during your four years there. If I had to choose all over again, I think I would choose Yale now that I know I can get through the rough patches and have met some of my best friends and mentors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: There is a LOT of work, but the student body is fantastic. It's truly a community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Yale flew me out to visit as part of their YES-W program. I had an amazing time.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Yale more than I imagined possible. Challenging, dynamic, incredible people, everything I ever wanted from college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely love attending Yale University. I feel that it was one of the best decisions I have ever made. I am entering my third year in the fall and couldn't imagine being anywhere else. What drew me to Yale was the close knit community and the welcoming and inclusive social space. I have friends from all walks of life and love to interact with people form all different backgrounds. I truly feel that I have grown as an individual as I have become equipped with the vocabulary to express eloquently just who I am and where I stand on certain issues to my peers.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: All-in-all, the courses and professors here are very educational and intelligent. However, some professors may be smart but not know how to convey their knowledge to students. Also, some of the introductory classes for STEM fields are not the best.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: This school  is great and filled with other reliable students
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Professors were very involved in students in smaller class sizes.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: If I had to do it all over again I'd probably choose princeton or harvard for their stronger math programs and more career-oriented student body. but if you're just looking for a casual, fun four years and being in a city isn't important to you, you should come here
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had very high expectations after reading all the student reviews on here, however after living here for a year I find myself wishing I'd gone somewhere else. Students here are very relaxed and not at all as ambitious as I'd hoped; there seems to be a lack of drive among the student body. Furthermore, there is significant pressure to present yourself as being super happy and ecstatic to be here - and resources/administrative support for mental health issues are very lacking. Classes are good in the humanities, not so great in STEM (I've taken more than one bad math classes!). The social scene is ver active but going to the same places (Toad's) over and over again gets old very quickly.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: yale is a great place to go to school
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I would not want to be studying in my field at any other u.s. school for a masters degree.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The instruction I receive in my field is second to none for a masters degree in this country.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am very happy with my program and if I could, I would do it all over again.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
One time, I got to hold a human brain. It was an extremely profound experience.

Those kinds of profound experiences were the norm. The students were so passionate and dedicated. The school really cares about its undergrads.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Recent Alumnus

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great school with great people
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am very pleased with the level of instruction and opportunities available.
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Im glad I chose the school
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the atmosphere and student body, but I'm always wondering about whether or not I'll find a suitable job in my field
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Its a great social environment and everyone is happy
Overall%20Experience.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not a part of Greek life, but my best friend loves her sorority.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Lol. Yale students in general don't care about varsity sports, but intramural are a big part of campus life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We have the largest gym in the world
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It is possible to be very much a part of the social scene at my school without participating in Greek life. There is no real difference between Greek and non-Greek participating students. Greek life is mostly seen as a way to meet new people by those involved and as the party capitals of campus for those not involved in Greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore
