Student%20Life.Review: Sports do not play a huge role in campus life except on some occasions, such as when playing our rival. The biggest sporting event is "The Game," a football game between Yale and Harvard that is well attended and includes a lot of spirit. This is not the norm however and most people do not participate in the sports culture.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Sports are a big part of my schooling as I play on the women's ice hockey team. The school spirit is outstanding and we have a lot of support with our courses while being away for games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: I'm in a sorority, and I really like it.  We have lots of mixers and parties to go to.  My only complaint is that it's not as satisfying (as far as making actual friends goes) as I expected it would be.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: No one comes to Yale just for athletics, but if that's your thing, there's definitely something Yale has for you.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Greeks are viewed very well by non-Greeks.Their are plenty of  Greek housing available. Greek life makes the atmosphere of the campus comfortable.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: The school spirit is very high. The coaches are amazing and their is great team performance.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: it doesn't really affect anything
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: good facilities, less good teams
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: people go to yale for the academic quality, but athletics are still great
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not very familiar with the Greek life, but I have hear that many people have positive experiences with it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We got some of the best teams in the country!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It is not a big part of campus culture. There are frat parties but they are not important.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: School spirit is more around the school as a whole than the athletics program
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We don't win very often. Still fun to go and watch.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: As someone in a sorority, I love it, but it still has its flaws
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: A lot of athletes, but they don't dominate
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I don't pay attention haha.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I have nothing to say about athletics? Harvard-Yale was sorta fun even though football is boring and we lost again?
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The culture here is that there can be a large separation between the athletes and "narps" or non-athletic regular people. While this divide can be frustrating, the sports culture otherwise is great. Some sports are better attended than others, such as Hockey and Basketball. It would be better if the football field were closer to campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are lots of attractive guys and girls here. What's great is that everyone has a unique personality or something that differentiates them from the general population. That's why they got into this school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Yale's administration is for sure old-school but they eventually move along with the times.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Campus security focuses on safety, any other discipline is honor-based. No complaints here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I have not had much experience with the strictness on campus, which might speak for itself.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Yale is surprisingly lenient when it comes to drug and alcohol usage on campus. Their reasoning is that they don't want students who are in danger to be afraid to tell administration about problems they might have, so its treated as a health issue rather than a disciplinary issue. There are more protests/demonstrations at Yale than there are at similar institutions which is nice, since similar activity is likely to be shut down at other universities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: sports teams are pretty good. only event people actually care about is the game
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Give us plenty of freedom and its much appreciated
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: There are only a couple of sororities and they're pretty hard to get into. There are a lot of frats, though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most people here don't care about sports at all...
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: All the rules currently in place make sense, but it is also possible to have fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Most parties are at frats but they're open in the fall. Spring gets taken up by a lot of sorority-fraternity mixers at frat houses, but those usually open up to non-Greek after a couple hours. Most people in Greek life don't live in the houses (each house only has 7ish rooms), so the people who live in them actually want to. I don't know about the frat rooms, but the upstairs rooms in the sororities are soooo nice.

Greek life gets really big for freshman after rush at the beginning of second semester. Though most people by the numbers don't rush, a vast majority of people that "go out" do. If you life going to frat parties and such during first semester, you might feel left out second semester if you don't rush, if only because all of your friends that do rush will have mixers and semi-formals on the weekends.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Harvard Yale Game is huge, and there is tailgating for the rest of the football season, but otherwise sports just aren't that huge of a deal. A lot of the athletes party with their teams, but then they move on out to other parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Alcohol is treated as a medical issue, Frocos (freshman counselors) don't care. If you smoke, you might get 1 or 4 emails from your dean but from my friends' experiences, nothing ends up happening.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Standing up to those Fossil Fuel Divestment nut-jobs is one of the best thing they ever did. Plus they use the money for cool things.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: The facilities are great and Payne Whitney Gym is one of the greatest gyms in the country.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are some great faculty members on campus who are there to look out for you and only have your best interests in mind.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Decent amount of places to work out, Yale isn't extremely into varsity sports but a good number of people get excited about them. IM's are where it's at, though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Yale treats drinking as a health concern, not an offense.This means that health is the number one thing they focus on when it comes to dealing with student drinking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek atmosphere does not play into the community a lot.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Considering we're an Ivy League, we've been sort of overshadowed by other big name sports colleges. However, we do not cease to have endless amounts of spirit and love for our sports teams, especially when Harvard-Yale games come around in any sport. We really love Yale sports (and hate Harvard).
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Unfortunately, class divide tends to get perpetuated at Yale, considering the high amount of upper-class students here. However, it hasn't really gotten in the way of friendships or regular college experiences for me.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Yale administration does anything it can to help the student population. Although the administration sometimes struggles to interpret the student opinion and put it into action, they make student requests a top priority in increasing happiness, satisfaction, and safety within the school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Yale integrates intramural competitions with the residential college system, so everyone is always part of a team. All intramural events contribute points towards the Tyng Cup, which is awarded to the most athletically successful college every year.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Yale knows it's students are going to get drunk. They take care of you when problems come up, and keep everything confidential.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: I don't know anything about Greek life at Yale. I went to Duke for undergrad.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: So far my experience with them has been extremely positive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Fantastic athletics that many students follow and cheer on.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Administration was very personable and open to all students helping to make policies easier pass through the student body.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Fan support depends on the sport and rival team.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Perfect balance between safety and fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty sure the football team was terrible the entire time I was there. I think there were some sports we were good at, mostly the country club stuff-- fencing, rowing, sailing, etc.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Literally went through undergrad without going to a single frat party, and I think the same was true for a bunch of my friends. The Yale equivalent of Greek life is actually a cappella.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: They're pretty lenient when it comes to minor infractions like underage drinking. I know some people who had disciplinary action brought against the for illegally downloading music? There have been issues with campus administrators not providing adequate support to survivors of sexual assault.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: i don't know much about athletics but i do know the Game (harvard v. yale) is the only "important" sports event on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: the primary issues in many college students' minds (drinking policies, visitation policies) are non issues here. yale is extremely lenient. however on other issues (e.g. environmental policy) they tend to be very bureaucratic and not listen much to student input.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Most people don't do Greek life. Its influence is small. There's a specific set of people who are into it but they're a particular group - everyone else is doing their own thing and really doesn't care. A lot of freshmen tend to go to frat parties but anyone older than that who's at a frat party is a person who's really into greek life
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Yale is totally lax about their rules. It's great. I get to do whatever I want. I don't have to be treated like a child. As long as I'm not disturbing a bunch of people on a week night, it's all good.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are only three sororities. The fraternities are basically associated with the athletic teams.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Being a straight girl here can be hard since a good chunk of the male population is gay but other than that it's fine! Not many people date though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Yale is very diverse! A lot of wealthy people but there's also some variety.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Facilities are okay but probably not the best you'll see at elite schools. People don't really care about sports here with the exception of the Harvard-Yale game (!!) (but then again we usually lose so)
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life isn't very big. There's not really a point to being in a frat/sorority here
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's fine. They pretty much let you do whatever you want
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: If you want a school with huge tailgates before every football game, yale is not the school for you.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: They treat alcohol and drug use as health issues, so you won't get in trouble if you are caught drinking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The administration tries to give the image that the campus is really diverse in all aspects, but when you really get down to it, the majority of students are affluent white heterosexual males.  That demographic still holds the highest position in campus, and in some departments, women still fight for acceptance (both as students and professors).
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I do not participate in athletics myself, but have enjoyed attending many Yale varsity sports games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The campus is not very strict, but rather the university takes it upon themselves to educate students to be very safe in terms of alcohol consumption etc.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I don't get involved much with the Greek life, so it is unfair of me to say.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone takes their health and hygiene very seriously at this school. It shows in their appearance, vibrancy and ability to keep up with the workload.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Hockey's seems to be a big deal, and so is the Yale vs. Harvard football game....but I haven't seen much inclination for sports otherwise.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review:
I feel that Yale is very diverse when it comes to ethnic and racial backgrounds, I'm always meeting people from different countries and experiences.  

I would hesitate to say that there's as much diversity in economic background, most students come from families with comfortable incomes. That's not to say there aren't a few outliers.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Many good looking guys but hard to find a committed one.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is fun, but can look down on those that are not in the system.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Because we don't have strong varsity teams, there is a lack of support. Exception include Mens Ice Hockey and the Harvard-Yale football game (which we always lose). IM's are largely attended by freshmen and club sports are  not funded so they remain relatively unimportant.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: People are accepting of other cultures, races, religions and sexual orientations. However, very few are willing to actually learn about other cultures and actually interact on a deeper level with others of a different culture.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Yale has a very diverse community. Yale accepts students from a number of different countries and associations such as the International Students Organization, South Asian Society and the Asian American Cultural Center are very prominent. A number of students at Yale study on need-based scholarships so there is economic diversity. The LGBT community at Yale is also prominent.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Fraternities and sororities hold a number of parties and sorority and fraternity members do have more opportunities to attend social events and meet new people. However, greek students are not viewed any differently than non-greeks. Certain greek societies have more money than others and nicer housing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Non-varsity students actively participate in intramurals; there are 12 residential colleges which compete every year for the Tyng Cup. The ice hockey team at Yale were the NCAA champions in 2013 and attract a huge crowd for both home and away games. The athletic facilities are one of the best in the country; Yale hosts the New Haven Tennis Open each year before the US Open.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It is very open to all sexual orientations, also very good will all races, but not a very friendly place for conservatives.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The residential college system works kind of like a Greek system already.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Intramural hockey can get pretty intense, and the rivalry games (Harvard) are always so much fun!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They're all just people in the student body. The student body as a whole is by and large quite wonderful.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review:
There's definitely a lot of school spirit, but attendance of actual games is pretty sparse, unless we're playing a rival or are in contention for a championship. The Harvard-Yale Game (football) is one of the hugest, most important events of the year, and is always a lot of fun to attend. Lots of people go the Yale-Princeton game as well. Since the hockey team's been doing so well, I believe there has been high turnout at a lot of those games.

Otherwise, people follow Yale sports, but I don't think people go to a lot of the games/competitions.

As for gym facilities, each residential college has its own small gym, and then Payne Whitney has one of the best gyms in the country. There are also fitness programs offered. Students who are interested in fitness have a lot of options in quality facilities.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review:
People are so interested in learning about one another and their unique backgrounds and perspectives. On the flip side, everyone was very open and willing to gently correct ignorance, rather than getting angry. That was absolutely amazing.

The downside was that you still had phenomena like all the black students sitting together at lunch, rich students just continually not understanding that money was a significant barrier for some people.

And then there's the fact that a lot of students, faculty, and administrators are completely willing to let a culture of misogyny slide, and even cover for star athletes or renowned professors who harass or assault female students.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: This isn't true of all fraternities, but there are a couple (DKE, Zeta Psi) who consistently, at least once or twice a year, behave in a way that publicly degrades women. It embarrasses the University and contributes to a hostile environment for women on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: At Yale University, there are paople from almost every state and many countries.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: As someone who went to a totally homogenous high school, I think Yale's diversity is great. Definitely there are situations that make it more difficult to be of a lower socioeconomic status, but I feel like that's something that's changing and getting more and more attention.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I would say that the administration overall works to keep the student's interests at the top of the priority. There have been some issues that have come up, academic and otherwise, but in these cases YCC (Yale College Council) has done a great job of confronting the administration and getting as much change as possible.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I say it's okay because it's so not necessary to have a great social life on campus. Fraternities and sororities have mixers and parties amongst themselves, but there are also plenty of other events that are with sports teams, or open to the student body as a whole. For those who aren't greek, nearly every student organization has a social side, which is why I think Greek life isn't too popular, because no one feels like they really need it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Sports don't get enough attention
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The frats are usually the move during the weekends
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone dresses really well and are tall.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The student work out facility could be upgraded but it certainly does the job.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are high standards here!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It is a very attractive school
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Its lenient enough to have fun while still being safe
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It depends with what greek society one is involved in, some are really fun and throw great parties others are snobby.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They are not on the same par as Alabama r Notre Dame but still a huge part of campus especially the ivy league games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The campus is large enough that you have a good chance of meeting someone to your liking, whatever you seek, but small enough that you have a chance of running into people you know, building a great community feel.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Yalies are very accepting of people of all walks of life. Although the overwhelming majority of the campus is very liberal and nonreligious (at least to all appearances) as a fairly conservative Christian (in science classes, no less) I have hardly felt judged or shamed for my faith at all. And the campus is truly diverse in many aspects. We are the "gay Ivy", so take that as you will, and there are actually people from everywhere on the planet that I know and am friends with. If you want to truly open your horizons to all the different ways that humans think and behave, come to Yale. You will learn just as much from your classmates as you will from your classes.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There's nothing really special about Greek life at Yale. Many people are in it but you wouldn't know it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Very diverse campus with many international students
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The strictness is perfect. Yale has mastered the balance between a safe and fun environment by establishing a fair level of strictness
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The student body is very diverse and as a result everyone is accepting.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Great fan support throughout the school
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I looked at several colleges where athletics were the selling point of the school, and obviously this is not true for Yale. If you're looking for a school where football is king, look elsewhere, you will be disappointed.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's pretty diverse. Basically my world view has rapidly expanded since I've gotten on campus. The diversity is incredible.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Honestly couldn't be better. Police and Security guards are super helpful and the campus is extremely secure. Administration treats underage drinking as a health issue and not a disciplinary one, so freshman ragers are commonplace. No one cares if you bring people in and out of your suite. It's actually the best campus I've been on in regards to personal freedoms.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Yale is the most tolerant and accepting place. Go Yale :)
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Yalies are pretty attractive people.  Lots of good-looking people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Yale has a great, accessible Intramural Sports scene.  Hockey and Football are somewhat big.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They throw great parties, and they are mostly accepting of everyone.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The campus is extremely diverse and generally liberal, but there are also many conservatives here too.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not sure if the question is "how strict do I think Yale is" or "what do I think of Yale's strictness", but I answered the latter.  The schoolmhas a phenomenal atmosphere.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life has little effect on the campus, which is the way it should be. All parties at Yale are open parties, which is nice so even freshman are guaranteed to have a grand old time. It is easy to go Greek if you want to, the frats are best at throwing late-night mixers that are sometimes fun post-Toads (the off campus club 30 seconds away from your dorm).
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: There is literally every single kind of person here. Yale is known as the "gay ivy" for good reason: being gay here is 100% accepted and it's not weird at all or looked down upon in the least. It's definitely better to be gay here than likely anywhere else in the country. Political beliefs = moderately liberal (all at least somewhat socially liberal, diverse fiscally/economically). Economic background and ethnic/racial diversity, there is literally everyone you could possible meet you will meet.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Three types of athletics: IMs, Club, and Varsity. IMs are very low intensity and fun and non-committal. Club is a worse version of varsity, and they are generally more intense, but their games are not well attended. Varsities are well attended, especially Yale-Harvard, and a big time commitment. Sports are definitely present on campus, but not overbearing like at some other universities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Yale Divinity School has a wonderfully diverse atmosphere. Students of all backgrounds and orientations are made to feel welcome and accepted, with student organizations for additional support.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Rules and regulations are mostly focused/enforced based on student safety.  This is particularly true with regards to alcohol.  If you're not bothering others or hurting yourself, you can probably do it.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: If you can get into Yale, the administration trusts you to not destroy the college in a drunken riot. Parties and alcohol are abundant if you are looking for it. On move-in day, a freshman unloaded a large pack of beer from his parent's car, and I saw a police officer nearby laughing. No one really cares if you drink or get a bit rowdy. Just be respectful of others, and everything will be fine. I'd also like to note that those who don't want to drink are not pressured to do so. Basically, everyone respects each others decisions.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The majority of students have competed at least once in an intramural sport- we have everything from basketball to ultimate frisbee to water polo to table tennis, and it's a lot of fun! As far as varsity sports, we are not so hot (although we just got a new university president who may change that). Our men's hockey team won the NCAA national championship last season, but our other sports are mediocre at best. School spirit can be seen at hockey and women's volleyball games, as well as most games against Harvard (especially at "The Game").
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There's a saying around Yale: "one in four, maybe more". Except it's more like, "one in two, maybe you". Good luck being a straight girl on campus. Trust me, you will have your heart broken at some point because you fell for a guy who turned out to be gay.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The campus police foster a healthy environment that enforces safety and health rather than punishment. They are very lenient on underage drinking, and would rather have you take a friend to Yale Health or report a problem than hide it, so there is very rarely an instance where a student gets in severe trouble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Yes, students' interests and talents are very diverse--and that is the only diversity that should really matter. There's also the more superficial diversity universities like to tote--racial, ethnic, national, sexual, vertical, and horizontal (although students tend to be in pretty good shape).
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is a lot of diversity in race, sexual orientation, and background, but almost everyone here subscribes to the same moderate liberal ideology in a sort of boring way. Anyone who dissents is not tolerated and possibly shunned, and challenging, controversial, and respectful political discussions are hard to find outside of the YPU.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Yale seems to be a very welcoming and accepting place.  It seems to be the case that students of all backgrounds are welcome - certainly, there is a warm attitude towards people of pretty much sexual orientation.  There could be better representation of people from rural areas or who aren't from Northeastern suburbs.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Great facilities and dedicated coaches.  School spirit is weak for some sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity sports at Yale are not that big of a deal for most people on campus. As athletes we have amazing coaches, trainers, facilities and access to tutors, etc. however we are sometimes stereotyped as less academically inclined than the general population, which I think is untrue. Some of the smartest people I have met at Yale are on my own team and because athletes have to juggle stressful school and athletic schedules, we are more likely to get everything done and stay on top of things.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Diversity at Yale is pretty awesome. I've met people from all walks of life here, however most students are white or asian.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life isn't a huge part of Yale. It's a fun way to meet new people and provides a lot of parties and events, but members understand that Yalies have very busy lives and can't commit fully to being in a sorority or frat like those at other colleges and universities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sports aren't huge except for men's hockey and The Game (the football game against Harvard in the Fall). For these the stadiums are completely full. Otherwise, I would say most people participate in sports either through IMs, Club Sports or Varisity, but there isn't a huge fan base.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Students at Yale don't care about Varsity sports (except for hockey and The Game). The Yale Administration doesn't put its money into varsity sports. But if you're a student who likes to be active, Yale is the place for you. They have great facilities, and there is a culture of active-ness and working out here. Also, the club sports scene is very active.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Yale has a quite diverse campus. There are people from all backgrounds and countries across the globe. There are groups on campus that celebrate just about every kind of diversity that exists here, e.g. Yale Black Women's Coalition, Queer Peers, the Baha'i Student Association, Arab Students' Association, Yale College Democrats, Vietnamese Student Association...the list goes on.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The people are so diverse, I find it almost pointless to generalize about this. Whatever you're looking for, Yale probably has it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: For faculty diversity, I would drop the grade to F
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are people of many different backgrounds on campus, whether with respect to race, religion, economic background, or sexual orientation. Most people I know here got at least some form of financial aid. Yes, most people here are probably white, liberal, and middle-class to upper-middle-class, but the stereotype of the snobby rich white Ivy Leaguer is entirely incorrect. In addition, the student organizations for minority groups are very visible on campus, so it's easy to find a community if that's what you're looking for.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Nobody really cares much about sports at Yale. Yale doesn't offer scholarships for Athletes and the only games people care about are against Harvard.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: People are relatively attractive although there is such a thing as "Yale goggles". Typical of most college scenes, people are less likely to want to date and are just looking for hook ups. Some guys are really interesting, just not sexually appealing. It's weird. Some preppy style, not overwhelming though. Most guys just want to dress nice. Girls dress well too.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I would say the most strict place on campus is in the freshmen residences on Old Campus; freshmen counselors (sort of like RAs) will enter your room if they think there's alcohol or smoking going on in the room. Two residential colleges don't live on Old Campus freshman year (Timothy Dwight and Silliman) so that's cool because they do't have to deal with strict freshman counselors. In residential colleges, parties of 20+ persons have to be registered in the masters office but you can get away with throwing parties as long as your noise level isn't too intense.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Girls obviously are intelligent. There are pretty good looking girls around campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not too much too look forward too, but not terrible. There are bigger draws on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are students from all over the world. Plain and simple.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most of the guys and girls are really, really, ridiculously good-looking. It's apparent that many people put thought and consideration into their physical appearance; it's reflected both in the style of clothes they wear and the care they put into their hair, face, nails, etc. There's a circulating conspiracy that Yale admits people based on how attractive they are ( I have no idea the mechanisms that allow for this to happen) and sometimes, I am convinced that is true. You will always be able to find someone who you find absolutely beautiful (and obsess over lol) no matter your orientation.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is available for pretty much everyone who wants to be apart of it. The frats and sororities are not too exclusive and usually let pretty much everyone come to the parties.  If you want free alcohol, you should get there early before it runs out.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not as big of a sports culture here, except for Ice Hockey, where we are really good. Football is only big for the Harvard Yale Game
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Lenient but Responsive – The level of campus strictness is just the right amount. Yale police officers have jurisdiction of school grounds so they are the ones dealing with students, not the real New Haven police. Yale officers are extremely friendly people who are looking out for students' best interests; they are not out to get you. They know it is a college campus and that students are drinking underage. My friends during freshman year have walked across Old Campus with a 30 rack of beer while the officers smiled and wished a good day. This doesn't mean things are out of control. Parties cannot be crazy or insanely loud, since most take place within the dorms and some others are bound to be sleeping or studying. In most residential colleges there are designated party suites and a fund for throwing parties. The master of the college would grant a social fund and allow students to throw registered party (these students would have to be 21 to register). It's a great place to be social. From Wednesday to Saturday each week, there is usually something going. Yalies really know how to work hard and party hard.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: It's Fine – There's nothing special with Greek life -- although they have parties occasionally, it is not a big thing to be in a fraternity or a sorority.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty Lax – Yale pretty much lets its students do their own thing. Most kids who go to Yale are pretty responsible, and so there really isn't a need for strict control.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Very very lax – Yale is great about rules. They enforce rules about cheating and stuff but as far as drinking goes, it's about health and safety, not about punishment.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Not great but definitely improving – Greek life at Yale has been consistently improving. It's nowhere near like big state schools, but sorority recruitment is becoming more and more popular, and fraternities throw awesome, popular parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: not so hot – The people involved in athletics and Greek life are generally attractive. Outside of that, though--slim pickings.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Cute Girls, Preppy Guys – But the majority of the guys are interested in the same sex. You'll just have to deal with it - there are plenty of diamonds but don't let yourself get so caught up you forget that the social scene here is all about the one night stand.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Far more ethnically diverse than Cambridge UK. Cambridge UK has less than 1% black students (which is proportional to the number of black people in England). Yale has far more black people.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Great Facilities, Poor Spirit – Yale is continuing to decline in its athletics. Our academic standards for athletes are higher than the other Ivy schools and this has resulted in a decline in top recruits and therefore poorer performance and not as much depth on teams. Along with losing season, is poor fan base and not much school spirit. However, the facilities are great.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Better than Harvard. Yale has some good looking guys and girls, and some not so good lucking guys and girls. It definitely is not like ASU, USC, UCLA in terms of attractive people. However, it does fine overall... just be sure to wear your "Yale goggles" since the standards are a little lower than normal.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Alcohol okay, weed not. For whatever reason, Yale really seems to condone alcohol--even to the point of excess and danger. That is, it is very easy to drink underage without getting in trouble and Yale does not really care if you become an alcoholic. However, Yale police and campus culture in general do not like Weed on-campus and you can get in a lot of trouble for it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: We are good at a few preppy sports--squash, crew, etc. However, Yale is not really good at any of the main sports: Football, basketball, etc. Additionally, the administration does not really support athletics, so athletics are a rather small part of campus life. Jocks often hang out together, and rarely will you see anyone attend a football game except for Harvard-Yale.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review:
Pretty Smart – Yalies deserve their reputation for being gorgeous. Better yet, they're really interesting people! :)

Finding the time and opportunity to date can be a challenge, though I do know several happy couples. Take advantage of Yale's "screws" (blind date dances) and get your suitemates to set you up with that cute guy/girl from section!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not Especially Important – Greek life really isn't a huge part of life at Yale.  Some people are in Greek societies and really like them, but your social life is definitely not limited if you aren't in one.  Everyone can goes to most frat parties.  I like that aspect, so that's why I'd rate it highly.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: You will find a wide array of students from every walk of life and from all over the globe. There is no way to stereotype the student population here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most Ideal Situation – Yale does a great job of taking the student's health and safety at priority. A student is never punished for getting help for a drug/alcohol problem or incident. The most that will happen is the student will have a short conversation with his/her residential college dean about the incident. Parents are not involved.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Safety First, Then Consequences – So far I haven't really heard of students getting into severe trouble this year, but it definitely can happen. Plagiarism is taken very seriously, and due to recent Title IX disputes, there has definitely been great pressure to improve the sexual environment on campus. I'm pretty sure I had to go to 4 required "sex talks" within my first two weeks because the administration wants to prevent unhealthy relationships and misconduct. Overall, the safety of the student is the primary concern. Punishment for behavior usually comes second.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Shockingly Laid Back – There is plenty of diversity in appearance and personality, and it is impossible to not find friends with similar interests. Many of the students dress very nicely absolutely every day, but there is also a great number of students who appreciate a good sweat pants day. For the most part, everyone is surprisingly down to Earth and willing to help each other.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Good Looks – While the girls tend to look better than girls, there are great looking people of both genders. The guys also tend to be preppier. Main styles of dress on campus are either athletic or preppy. And almost everyone is very social--work hard, party hard. Most of the time, though, the furthest a "relationship" will go is friends with benefits. There definitely are a few relationships though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: More About Safety Than Punishment – The school is genuinely more concerned with students' health than punishing them for under-aged drinking. However, if you are sent to the hospital for alcohol poisoning and not just the clinic there will definitely be a meeting with the dean and a call to your parents. Nothing to strict or harsh.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Welcome Home. You can get away with pretty much anything here, they are really good about sensible policies, if anything, I wished some people had been punished more for their inability to govern their own actions.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
The "Gay" Ivy – Many Gay men, raging feminists, and there remains an atmosphere of discussion.
People of high-economic status mostly have no idea they are meeting someone whose family is lower middle-class. The same happens the other way around, all the time. In general, people meet each other and become friends without thinking of or ever finding out about economic backgrounds.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Fairly Lax – Campus police are quite relaxed when it comes to the rules.  They are more concerned about student safety than anything else.  Many students keep alcohol in their room.  As long as you keep quiet about drinking, you probably won't get busted.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Diversity at Yale is excellent.  There are students from all over the world and you get to meet and interact freely with people with a totally different background from yourself.  Yale is diverse when it comes to socioeconomic status, religion, sexual orientation, and political beliefs, not just race and ethnicity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not a Big Deal – Most frats are uninteresting or unsavory, with some exceptions. Sororities don't have much of a presence.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Hit or Miss – The girls here are very attractive on average, with great taste in clothes.. The guys are also pretty attractive. However, many of the attractive guys here are either gay, taken, or completely uninterested in any sort of long term relationship. Not to say that it's not possible, but it takes quite a lot of effort.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Nothing Special – Men's hockey is pretty big here (because it's like the only sport we're good at on a national level, go figure). Other than that, though, nobody really seems to care. Football game tailgates have a much higher attendance rate than the games do. Harvard - Yale football is probably the one game that the majority of the student body bothers to watch. School spirit is pretty weak.

Also, it's an ivy league school. You're not gonna find the caliber of athlete that you'll find at just about any non-ivy. The athletics in the ivy league (even though it's D1) are just weaker.

Yale's saving grace, however, is that the athletic facilities are fantastic.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There If You Want It, but Don't Bother – Doesn't affect the lives of most students, but can stir up controversy for its own sake.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics is visible and just about EVERYONE participates in one or two IM sports every year.  Varsity athletes probably don't receive as much attention as those in the NCAA powerhouses but most choose Yale for a Yale education and the chance to still play their sport.  But there is a good deal of fan support in basketball, football and hockey.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Beautiful People – Love this place...Everyone is good looking, extremely interested and interesting. Student life is awesome!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Yale trusts students to watch after each other and to keep themselves in check
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Guys and Girls – If girls are pretty they know they are pretty. And there are a lot of attractive girls here. I mean they are both smart and pretty, of course they are going to know that. Appearances can matter a lot to a big part of the population, it's all about impression, they're all nerds but want to prove that they can be cool too. This goes for both sexes. Some guys are cute, others hot, but they are all nerds.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics is good and almost everyone is involved in the residential college intramural sports.  Varsity sports is big among those participate, but with the exception of the popular Yale-Harvard Football Game, fan support is pretty minimal because Yale students are all busy doing their own thing.  Yale Varsity have won NCAA Championship in a couple of varsity sports in 2010.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Many Nationalities, Races, Cultures, Economic and Polical Backgrounds!  Because of the awesome residential colleges, we all intermingle and socialize together - it's GREAT at Yale!
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Not Strict at All – There are basically no rules, or if there are, they are not very enforced.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Cute Guys – Lots of preppy white guys, but there are definitely all kinds of guys on campus. The guys are usually pretty cute. There are a whole lot of good-looking girls here too.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: As Diverse as They Come – Yale is very diverse, with students from all 50 states and tons of foreign nations. You meet new people everyday from all over.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Intramural Driven, With Small Pockets of Varsity Enthusiasm – Our varsity teams are not that good in general. The athletes work hard, but really we are only very talented in Squash, Sailing, Fencing, and Hockey. The enthusiasm for these sports is not very high, either. A lot of people go to hockey games, but for the most part a sporting event is not the most popular social event. Intramural sports, however, are very popular. most students play in at least one, and are very spirited when it comes to representing their residential college. That being said, there are great workout facilities, fields, and courts for varsity and intramural athletes, and for all students to use.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are quite a few frats, and six sororities (three traditional, three cultural). Parties are generally open to everyone, and it can be a huge part of your social life, or a nonexistent one. The frat houses are off-campus and generally pretty gross, but that doesn't matter if you're just there for a party.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Could Actually Be More Strict – I believe Yale may actually give too much freedom to its students, facilitating passively some harmful life choices.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: De Facto Segregation – It's a difficult feat to accomplish in any institution, and it's oftentimes more about the individual people than the efforts of the institution, but people still, a lot of the times, segregate themselves by race. Granted, that is not the case 100% of the time, but still enough to be noticeable.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life at Yale in no way dominates any kind of social life. But it does exist and is actually really fun if you find yourself gravitating toward that group of kids. I personally enjoy it a lot.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity Sports – Varsity sports are pretty mediocre at yale. The excitement at football and basketball games is subpar and our teams' performances aren't much to write home about. Hockey is actually the one shining light in a sea of utter darkness. Our team is actually competent, and is usually ranked within the top 10 nationally. The rink is small enough that we pack it pretty frequently, which makes for a really high energy experience.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not a Bad Pool, but Who Has Time to Date? Yalies do a pretty good job of shedding the ugly geek stereotype.  Okay, so if your ideal is the dyed-blond hair, lots of makeup, fake eyelashes kind of girl, you'll have slimmer pickings, and ditto for girls into big bearded bruiser kind of guys.  But if your type isn't quite so MTV Spring Break, you'll find Yale has a pretty good dating/hook-up pool: people here tend to be smart, interesting, fun, and pretty good-looking.   If anything, the girls here can be a little intimidating; how *does* that girl in your section manage to make such brilliant comments about Chaucer, sing in an a cappella group, play IM sports, and look great while doing all three?  I can't comment in an informed way on the guys, except to warn straight girls that there are a lot of gay men here-the saying is 1 in 4, maybe more-so your dating pool is going to be smaller.  All that said, be warned that pretty much everyone at Yale seems to fall into three categories: not doing much of anything, hooking up casually on weekends, or in a long-term super-committed relationship.  There isn't much casual dating here, probably because people are so involved both with their academic and extracurricular lives.  Every so often, there'll be an op-ed in the Yale Daily News or the Yale Herald from a sad single guy or girl bemoaning this, but nothing will change.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Safety Over Punishment Aka. Don't Be Stupid – Yale's policy is safety over punishment - as long as you're not obvious/ stupid about it, campus police won't bother you. If you get sick, the university prefers that students report it and make sure you get to the hospital/ health center. If you can walk out by 8AM, nothing ever gets written down.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review:
Ims Are Great! I've played a number of intramural sports and found them to be a lot of fun.  There's a great IMs community and it's a really easy way to meet upperclassmen from your residential college.  In addition, since IM games are played by one college against another, it doesn't feel like a meaningless/random selection of people.  Levels of play vary from sport to sport but there is definitely something for everyone!
There isn't a big varsity sports culture among the general student body, except for during The Game, which is an awesome time!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is decent, and people will go to the parties. But, realistically, Greek life here isn't nearly as significant as it is at state schools. I guess that should be expected.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Variety of People; Serious Relationships and Hookups – Everyone is engaging. lots of variety.  some people are into the hook up scene, while many others opt for serious relationships.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Yale's campus is incredibly diverse.  My roommate has a full need based scholarship here.  I have friends from all over the world and with vastly different ideas about politics, religion, and themselves.  I've learned so much since being here, especially because there is a cooperative respect between students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty Sparse – There are a few frats that throw parties. Other than that, you wouldn't know they exist.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not Bad – The looks are kind of like the GPAs; inflated, with a tight standard deviation.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: This Question Is Slanted – This question, and the sample answer, sounds like it's slanted towards "Duuuuude college rocks I'm so gonna get laid this weekend." Any college has its share of that, but I'm glad to say Yalies in general rise above the mundane. I've never spoken to any student or faculty but I've come away feeling enlightened, inspired, and impressed. The university culture is one of intellectualism, openness, and debate. It's a noise of ideas. It's the best place and the best people in the world. I miss it.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Not That Many and They Just Host the Parties – Frats and less commonly sororities host parties at least every other weekend, but other than that are not very visible on campus. There is not a sense of exclusion-anyone can go to their parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: They Don't Care – Yale does nothing about underage drinking and drug use unless you get really sick. I don't wish for greater policing on campus. It's great that the administration gives students the freedom to do what they want. However, the fact that a student recently died from drinking and a drug overdose reveals the lack of compassion towards students. Administrators do not really look out for students-they turn a blind eye, leaving students in trouble from drinking or drug use to depend wholly on their friends, instead of on the administration.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Middle of the Road – The Game is about the only sports game most students go to. Varsity athletes tend to hang out with each other; they are often not seen as as intelligent as the rest of the student body. Yale varsity sports are honestly not very good. Sports teams do host some parties in sports team houses, but this tends to further the association between athletes and partying that already exists. For example, people say you see a lot of athletes at Toad's. 
A lot of students do go to the gym to exercise on a regular basis, and the gym has very nice facilities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: What Strictness? Basically, we're free to do what we want. There are no restrictions on having overnight guests, and the authorities pretty much look the other way on underage drinking as long as it's in moderation and kept in suites. This does have the unintended effect of a ridiculously high rate of hospitalizations for binge drinking - but that's something individuals need to make better choices about.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Our Teams Are Pretty Good...But No One Cares – From what I read in the newspapers, we have some pretty good teams. Volleyball, soccer, sailing, hockey...all good. But I don't know of anyone who makes an effort to see games or keep up on statistics. We are really involved in IMs though. People are really into IM sports, more so than even major events like football games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Better Than I Expected – I was told that the political climate here was decidedly liberal, but on coming here I don't feel like there's any particular bias against moderate or conservative viewpoints. I'm not part of the political union, but it seems fairly active, with members from many different areas of the spectrum. Religious tolerance was a huge improvement over my high school, and so that itself has made the environment here feel much better. It's not perfect, of course, but it's definitely better than what I'm used to.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The student body at Yale is designed to be diverse.  Part of the admissions committees decision process rests on creating classes of Yalies who represent all types of people.  I feel like I have met students who represent nearly every different political, economic, sexual, and ethnic identities at Yale.  Students hail from dozens of countries and all 50 US states.  That said, there certainly is a high percentage of students from the Northeast, but may be due to the Yale's location (which is, after all, in the Northeast).
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: This school is amazing. Every possible class imaginable and more are offered! Taught by the brightest minds around
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: If you put the work in, you will be rewarded
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: Academics are great with a vast curriculum and many post-undergraduate professional schools.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Majors are really easy to switch since you don't really have to commit until junior year (and even then switching is possible). Some majors require applications if there is high demand but not many.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Considering I don't have to be committed to my major until junior year, I enjoy it so far. I've only really taken math prerequisites and intend to take Physics and an Astro intro course next year but I probably won't delve deep into the major until fall of junior year. I might not even stay an Astro major, but Yale's flexibility with majors makes that okay.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Everyone wants to hire Yalies. Yale opens employment doors that simply do not exist even at great schools.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: I truly enjoy my program.  It's very rewarding.
Academics.Author: College Student

Academics.Review: Academics are very important and valued throughout the entire campus.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Very difficult to get into program which keeps up the high caliber of graduates. Undergrad plus ample experience required to even apply and once applications are complete interviews are required before acceptance.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: So, grade inflation was a thing, but I feel like I learned a lot.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: haha, it's yale. academics are going to be tough. professors' attitudes towards students vary wildly. some take great interest in undergrads and some actively brush them off. in terms of academic support and buildings (libraries) - yale is pretty good. a lot of nice peer tutoring options, a writing center, and a million (only a slight exaggeration) beautiful libraries
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I'm not in one yet
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I've switched from math to english because I hated the program - Yale is much stronger in the humanities do NOT come here to major in STEM
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I wouldn't major coming here for science or math. You'll have many more resources available to you at more well-rounded schools like princeton or harvard (and MIT/Stanford for engineering)
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I've had some good experiences but honestly just as many bad ones. Definitely haven't experienced the "undergraduate focus" that they say exists here...plus the college is expanding so it's just going to get worse
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Unfortunately my academic experience at Yale hasn't lived up to the hype...most humanities classes are good but I've basically been teaching myself math for the last year since my professor isn't good and the TAs aren't much better. If you're thinking about doing something science related I'd look elsewhere!
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I have gotten a lot of professional experience in my field through connections I have made at the school. The pay is a little less than what I would expect after graduation but still quite high for my level.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I love my program. It is fun, exciting, different and there a lots of opportunities.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Anyone can study anything. Very few majors are capped.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Great academics, possibilities and there is a lot of support. The competitive nature and the GPA system can be overwhelming but still yield the best results.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Career fairs take place at least once a year and a number of consulting and finance/banking firms visit the campus to recruit students for internships and jobs.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I majored in Psychology which is one of the most popular majors in the school. The workload is average. The faculty are talented and there are a number of research labs that students can join to gain practical experience.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The application for Global Affairs is sophomore year, so you can explore the gateway classes before committing to the major.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: There are only a few majors you have to apply for at Yale (including mine), which vary in selectivity. But the rest of them you can just declare whenever you want, and it's super easy to change your mind.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I am a dual degree student so I have to take more classes than others, so my workload is quite large.  But the teachers and your advisors are there if you need them.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: What you sign up for class-wise is really based on the requirements of your major and your interests.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I enjoy the program, but I'm really not too sure how I feel about the internship/job opportunities that it will give me
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Administrative support is great at this school - very helpful and responsive
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: School has lots of professional connections, but you still have to do most of the work to find your own internship
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Most of the grad school professors are great and the classes are very interesting
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Quality of the program really depends on what classes you're taking and what professors you have
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Economics is a very developed major with a moderate workload, many internship opportunities, and great professors
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Really the best. in the world.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Again, the majors are well thought out and relevant.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The majors are well-throught out and nicely varied.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Admission to any program at Yale College is done by applying to Yale College itself.  You do not have to declare your major until sophomore year.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The academic environment is collaborative, challenging, and overall superb.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Yale's professors really care about your education.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review:
Academics at Yale are incredible. I am only a freshman, yet I am already taking classes from some of the best professors Yale has to offer - all of them have conducted significant amounts of research or authored books in their fields. Classes are a joy, my fellow students are inspiring and intellectually engaging, homework is intense but manageable, and professors are always easily accessible. My largest class this semester only has 16 students - the small class sizes really allow me to get to know my professors.

Yale has a huge variety of classes from which to choose, and flipping through the course catalog at the beginnings of the semesters can sometimes be overwhelming. But students are guaranteed to find classes that fit their particular interests within larger fields of study.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: It's Yale, so academics is pretty much the strong suit here
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I'd say one of the best things about academics at Yale is the variety of options when it comes to choosing classes. One of my favorite things about Yale academics is the shopping period, which alleviates a lot of stress when it comes to picking your schedule each semester. The professors as a whole are amazing, and there are endless options for classes.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: In my program (in the Divinity School) an internship/placement is required. I have not done it yet, but everything I've heard has been good and I'm looking forward to it. There are many options, from different sorts of parish internship to placements in hospital and school chaplaincies. Best of all, it comes with a stipend, so you don't have to worry about the fact that it basically prevents you from having a job.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I'm new to the divinity school, but so far its wonderful. The campus itself is beautiful, all closed so that in the winter you don't have to walk outside between classes, it's in a safe part of town, etc. The people are wonderful, there are great musical opportunities, and placements/internships come with a stipend!
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: There is an endless supply of study areas from which to choose, so finding one that suits you is never a problem. Depending on the department and the individual professor, it can be a hit or miss. Some professors simply were not meant to be teachers and it's much more helpful to ask them questions directly at their office hours, or to talk to a TA. Other professors, however, are absolutely amazing. They understand why we don't understand and find creative ways to address those areas, they go out of their way to give us extra help, they motivate us and inspire us to push ourselves toward greater things.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I am pursuing a Spanish major, but I'm also doing pre-med. The Spanish department is quite small and nothing special, but it gets the job done and there are plenty of amazing study abroad opportunities, so achieving fluency relatively quickly is not beyond reach. As far as pre-med goes, it is definitely difficult to get A's if you didn't have the same opportunities as others in high school. That said, a lot of people realize after freshman year that pre-med isn't for them, and that eases up the competition for later on. It takes a lot of effort to get into the swing of things and to stay on top of all the requirements, but with a little bit of organization, time management, and the realization that getting a tutor is okay, pre-med at Yale can be conquered. Also, there are TONS of paid research opportunities for pre-meds, which do double duty serving as excellent experiences as well as sources of income.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: It's simple to be a Computer Science major; you just have to take all the pre-requisite classes. But those are very difficult, called "weeder" classes since they discourage people who aren't good from progressing.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Computer Science is fun, but lately it has been over-burdened with too many students (new interest!). The workload is high, but you get a lot of out of it, and connecting to other comp sci people you get a good job too.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Yes, Yale is an amazing place to be. I am planning to major in Computer Science, but the courses in this major are really theory-intensive. You don't get to do anything practical, whereas in other schools you end up making a website or app or game at the end of a semester. I think I'll get a good job graduating from Yale in Comp Sci, it has happened before to others
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I can't express in words. I feel joyful,spontaneous
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: no more to say the educational quality at Yale university
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: i read paper published by this university  with high quality.
Academics.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Yale offers just about anything you're looking for. Much more emphasis on sciences so if you're interested in engineering or the like, exciting time to be a part of the Yale community.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: It is really easy to get into most majors, like mine (Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology), but some majors you have to apply to after second semester sophomore year. The number of spots depend on the major. I'm not exactly sure how many you have to apply to but I'm only aware of two.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: For the past four years, I have worked as a student research in a couple of labs at Yale. Yale tends to provide excellent funding for international opportunities and amazing resources for you to find internships at home and abroad. From what I've heard, internship can either be paid or without pay. If its a summer, they are usually a full time commitment. The responsibilites tha you receivve depend on thie nature of the internship, if you have had experience that you bring to the internship, your potential to hold responsibility, etc...
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Tons of Internship Opportunities – Yale, because of its strong alumni network, gives you a ton of opportunities not found elsewhere. There are a bunch of outlets for exploration, and everyone can find internships on campus if desired. Pay ranges from $12-17, time is usually ~5-20 hours per week. I did a research assistant job last year and worked in a department on campus.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Political Science Is TOO BIG – Something like 45 percent of Yalies are Poli Sci majors, which is outrageous - it's hard to get specialized attention or to meet with the DUS. The Poli Sci website is archaic, the DUS is hard to meet with, and the requirements are so tedious and confusing it's ridiculous. You're better off picking another major with analytic thinking and taking Poli Sci classes according to interest.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Hard Classes...If You Don't Know Where to Go – Yalies often search out courses known as "guts" - classes where the material/tests/teacher are really easy, in order to supplement their grades. Here, schmoozing with the professor is what will get you a high grade along with trying your hardest. Otherwise, get ready to hang out with all the world-class academicians and a lousy C.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Great Opportunities – The Psychology Department at Yale  is excellent and some of the best professors belong to it. There are several labs on campus that students are able to become involved in during the year or over the summer. The curriculum is also flexible and enables students who want to be pre-med to major in psychology.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Helpful for the Most Part – Yale University, being an Ivy League school has high expectations but there is always help when you need it. There are tutors for just about every main subject within each dorm (residential college) and most professors have office hours or the teacher assistants do. The professors are often extremely intelligent but lack the ability to teach the material to students who are new to the subject. However, most of the small seminar classes have extremely helpful and devoted professors who encourage students to attend extra help and office hours.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Good professors – Yale has some great classes. In particular, I have really enjoyed the history, economics, and political science departments. However, the teachers in science/engineering/comp sci are less interesting overall. Yale is a good place to get a liberal arts education, but not a great place to be an engineer or get a practical education.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I Have No Program. I have no program. You only have to apply for two majors, cognitive science being one of them.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I haven't had to pick a major yet, but in terms of classes and feeling out what I want to do, Yale's been great. Freshmen have a ton of flexibility and barely any distributional requirements to fulfill. As for the classes I've had, they've been great--lecture professors are amazing and the TAs/section leaders, though they aren't always exactly great teachers, are always very accessible and willing to help. My one seminar (writing) professor was amazing as well.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The Pre-Med Program Is Hard, as Expected – Although the pre-med program is hard, that is to be expected, and the classes are taught by professors who really do love what they teach; this attitude spills over into the students. It is one of the main reasons I put up with the workload.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Just Getting Started – I just decided on my major this summer, so I can't speak much from my experience, but at Yale pretty much any major is a pleasure to be in as long as you pick the one that fits you best.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Wonderful Classes – Courses at Yale can definitely be amazing. I've taken wonderful classes myself, but I also know this through the online course evaluations that Yale provides to students considering taking certain classes. I've seen some raving comments about classes that have changed people's lives.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I Just Started – I am only at the beginning of my major, but so far everything is excellent.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Everything. Ever. Everything you can ever imagine taking is offered - this place is practically heaven for an academic.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Cognitive Science – It's incredible! It's a very close-knit major and Yale has the best Cog Sci professors in the world. They are so open to helping students and so passionate about the topic. I leave my classes in shock and excitement every day and my goal in life is to work on research with one of my professors.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore
